lead_paragraph: If accepted, the offer for “The Birth of a Nation,” about Nat Turner, would be one of the highest prices ever paid for a film making its debut at the film festival.

headline.main: Sundance Roars for a Black Film, and Fox Searchlight Bids $17 Million
headline.print_headline: Sundance Roars for a Black Film

abstract: Nate Parker film The Birth of a Nation has received enormous critical response at Sundance Film Festival, sparking bidding war between studios that Fox Searchlight has won by offering unprecedented $17.5 million for distribution rights; response to film, which is slave-revolt historical drama that stars Parker and features diverse cast, comes even as Academy Awards is facing widespread criticism for its all-white field of acting nominees.
